Posts.Content: I had back pain with docetaxel - I was told that the bloating means unusual pressure on sensitive areas. I increased my water intake and took some over the counter painkillers after checking with breast cancer nurse.
Posts.Title: FEC and back pain

Posts.Content: Dear Jan, I had this too. I rang the hospital (they have a 24 hour cancer helpline) and they put my dose down 20 per cent next time.  The next round was almost pain free although the pains returned for the final round. The hospital told me that these pains normally go after the first week - and that was true in my case. Take care
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: We've been struggling a bit with the sex too. My husband was very worried about my sore bits and hurting me as well as the things that you mentioned. We started small with hugs, massages and making time earlier in the day when I wasn't so tired . We didn't try to have full sex at first and it was a while before I felt like it but it did feel good to have our hugs back.
Posts.Title: I need to ask a very personal question?

Posts.Content: Dear invisible you, Hospitals have glitches with appointments all the time. If the hospital computer has lost you and missed the NICE deadline for your chemotherapy referral, then they will want to know. I would ring up and speak to the breast cancer nurse or the receptionist. I had to do this all the time when I got treated because the hospital was putting in a new computer system which either made my appointments twice or not at all.  best wishes Ms C
Posts.Title: Fed up, still waiting

Posts.Content: Glad to hear it all went well.
Posts.Title: Hi from barts

Posts.Content: I have bloating too - am trying to keep my fluid intake up which is supposed to help.
Posts.Title: Bloating and taxol

Posts.Content: I agree with Marsha. I was nervous while waiting for my results - but much less so once I was diagnosed and had stuff to do.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, but why am i so calm?

Posts.Content: I've had ten home injections for every chemo cycle - our local hospital policy seems to be to stuff you with every drug that could help you get through chemo intact. I go home with a carrier bag every time. I have now done 40 so just twenty to go. The best advice I had was to do them first thing in the morning and get them over with so they don't ruin the whole day.
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Katee, I had a very similar operation to Sally 4 months ago.  I did get lots of the weird side effects but they have gradually gone away. I still have some numbness and swelling but have full movement . I don't know how important driving is in your life but I would try and do a pre operation tidying and errands blitz so that you can come home to a tidy house , comfortable bedroom and fridge full of easy food. It's also worth checking that you've got some easy on tops with loose sleeves .
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: I wore my sports bra 24/7 at first and then wore a soft bra top at nights so that I could wash my sports bra out overnight.  I had to get my sports bra from Amazon - I chose the Goddess Sports bra with the silver mesh because like you I am very busty. I had a lot of bra extenders as well -I would shed one most days as the swelling went down.
Posts.Title: Bras after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Katee, My drains were clear plastic tubes which went from the incisions in my body into small square plastic packets to collect the blood etc . The nurses gave me a little fabric bag made by the local WRVS ladies to put the packets in when I was moving around so that I had my hands free. I was a bit awkward just after the op what with the drains and the anaesthetic and it was good to be in hospital with a toilet with grab rails . I would go for the overnight stay if I were you . best wishes
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: If it helps, I've now done 41 and I have a technique. Basically you line the needle up with your fat fold , so that the needle is going in at a very shallow angle. loosen your grip on the fat fold a bit and just put a tiny bit of pressure on so the needle tip goes in -you don't have to bang it in. Then you just have to put a little bit of pressure on the blue end so that it goes in very slowly. You don't have to force the needle in -slow and steady is fine. Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Epic fail lol
